answers.author: Matthew Reges
answers.text:
This job description might be helpful for you --from my hometown, with apologies for the website formatting. The duties are divided between Finance and Economic Development. The grants portfolio is broad, from big CDBG projects to small DHS grants for police equipment. Winchester is about 75 miles from DC, maybe a bit less influenced by big-city salaries than Woodstock is by Chicago?
The second position is in my current organization, the planning department, with a more focused portfolio of grants to administer.
Performance bonuses may be easier to define for a position like this one, but it's a bigger discussion on how to establish evaluation and bonuses for certain positions but not others in your organization. Good luck! 
http://agency.governmentjobs.com/winchesterva/default.cfm?action=viewclassspec&classSpecID=792359&agency=2149&viewOnly=yes
http://agency.governmentjobs.com/charlottesville/default.cfm?action=viewclassspec&classSpecID=103519&agency=1498&viewOnly=yes

author: Terry Willcockson
text: Hello!  The City of Woodstock is researching adding a Grant Writer position., and is having difficulty finding examples for this role among municipalities.   Do you have a Grant Writer staff position, and if so, could you provide the salary range?  In addition to base salary, do you offer any incentive or bonus opportunities to reward high achievement?  Thanks so much for any response to humanresources@woodstockil.gov !
title: Grant Writer salary range
